NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Product 1..1ElementProduct
codeSet 0..1BackboneElementProduct code set
productCode 0..*CodeableConceptProduct code
PCID 0..1CodeableConceptIDMP PCID
MPID 0..1CodeableConceptIDMP MPID
PhPID 0..*CodeableConceptIDMP PhP
identifier 0..1BackboneElementSet of identifiers
dataCarrierIdentifier 0..*IdentifierData Carrier Identifier
lotNumber 0..1stringLot/Batch Number
name 0..*stringProduct Name
composition 0..1BackboneElementComposition
ingredient 0..*BackboneElementIngredient
substanceName 0..1stringSubstance name
substanceCode 0..*CodeableConceptSubstance code
ingredientRole 0..1CodeableConceptIngredient role
substanceQuantity 0..1RatioSubstance quantity
description 0..1stringTextual Composition
marketAuthorizationHolder 0..1SimpleOrganizationMarket Authorization Holder (MAH)
manufacturer 0..1SimpleOrganizationmanufacturer

Documentation for this format

name: Product
title: Product
description: A product  that have or should have been administered to a subject that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s).

element.definition: A product  that have or should have been administered to a subject that includes one or more specific antigen(s) aimed at developing an immune response in an individual to provide protection from a vaccine preventable disease(s).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Codes that describe this product at different levels (e.g. package, medicinal product, pharmaceutical product, product cluster)
Set of codes identifying a Virtual or an Authorized Packaged Medicinal Product (PC), Medicinal Product (MP) , Pharmaceutical Product (PhP) or other product codes.
Code identifying the IDMP Packaged Medicinal Product
Code identifying the IDMP Medicinal Product
Code identifying the IDMP Pharmaceutical Product
Identifiers typically related to the supply chain management, but often used also for other purposes as the fight against falsified and counterfeit medicines; adverse event reporting, and so on.

Set of identifiers associated to this instance of the product. It could be a global (e.g. GTIN) or a national identifier. 
The identifiers may refer to different package levels such as primary packaging or secondary packaging.
The identifier of the lowest packaging should be captured.
The lot number of the Administrable Immunizing Agent, as assigned by the manufacturer.
Product Name
Composition of this product
Information about the igredients composing this product
Name of the substance / specified substance

Code identifying this substance / specified substance. When active it is the substance that triggers an immune response to a specific disease with a role of an antigen. Derivable from vaccine product.
Role of this ingredient
Quantity of this substance / specified substance. It can be per unit of presentation or per concentration.
Textual description of the product composition
the organisation that holds the authorisation for marketing a Medicinal Product in a region
Organisation that holds the authorisation for the manufacturing process
